newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Cambodia not to be admitted to ASEAN this week.
newsitem.headline: Cambodia not to be admitted to ASEAN this week.

text.p: Cambodia will not be accepted as a member of the Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN) this week, Malaysian Foreign Minister Abdullah Ahmad Badawi said.
He told a news conference after a lunch meeting of the seven ASEAN foreign ministers that there was still political instablity in Cambodia.

"We feel there is still instability in Cambodia, and we reaffirmed our decision (of July 10) not to induct Cambodia on the 23rd," Abdullah said. He added there is no change to Cambodia's status as an observer to ASEAN.
On the reasons for deferring Cambodia's membership, Abdullah also said, "The position of prime minister still remains unresolved."
"At the moment, as far as we are concerned, Prince (Norodom) Ranariddh is still first prime minister, and no new prime minister is coming up," he said.

Ranariddh was overthrown by Second Prime Minister Hun Sen earlier this month in a bloody coup. Hun Sen has nominated Cambodian foreign minister Ung Huot to replace Ranariddh, who remains in exile abroad.
